meanings.sent1: Her egomaniacal behavior made it difficult for others to get a word in during the conversation.
meanings.sent2: He was so egomaniacal that he only cared about his own achievements and never acknowledged others.
meanings.sent3: The egomaniacal cat insisted on sitting in the middle of the table, claiming it as her throne.
meanings.sent4: His egomaniacal attitude towered over the room like a dark cloud, casting a shadow on everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The egomaniacal boss demanded constant praise and attention, making the workplace a challenging environment.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive preoccupation with oneself
meanings.sent1: The egomaniacal student only talked about themselves and never showed interest in others.
meanings.sent2: She had an egomaniacal obsession with her appearance, spending hours in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: In a comical twist, the egomaniacal squirrel believed all the acorns in the park belonged to him.
meanings.sent4: Her egomaniacal focus on her social media presence turned her into a virtual celebrity in her own mind.
meanings.sent5: The egomaniacal actor refused to share the spotlight, always wanting to be the center of attention.

meanings.definition: Having an inflated sense of self-importance
meanings.sent1: His egomaniacal belief that he was always right led to many arguments with his friends.
meanings.sent2: The egomaniacal politician thought the entire success of the campaign was solely due to his efforts.
meanings.sent3: The egomaniacal sun thought the planets revolved around it, not realizing its place in the solar system.
meanings.sent4: Her egomaniacal view of herself as a queen made her treat everyone around her as mere subjects.
meanings.sent5: The egomaniacal artist considered their work to be above critique, dismissing any feedback as irrelevant.
